intro: Petastoma cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf petasite, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
